Articles.Content:
I've finally created an SSTO design I'm not afraid to share: the Lawn Darts mk. 1 and 2. (Confusingly, the mk. 1 is based off of a Mk. 2 drone core, and the mk. 2 is based off of a mk. 1 probe core.).

Mk. 1 on a suborbital trajectory. Honestly, I couldn't actually get this thing orbital, but I'm not a terribly good pilot, no matter how much I enjoy flying. I seem to remember the design from some scramjet test vehicle or other.

Download Lawn Dart mk. 1

the Lawn Dart Mk. 2 doing a remarkable job of not blowing up in the atmosphere. Note the acceleration numbers: it's pulling around eight gees. This is normal.

the Lawn Dart mk. 2's final orbit. Eccentric because I just stuck it at the horizon and burned away the rest of my thousand-odd m/s of dV (!).

Download the Lawn Dart mk. 2

Ascent profile: Engage SAS. 100% throttle until the wheels leave ground, then IMMEDIATELY throttle back down to 30%. Start a 30 degree climb. Forget about it until the apoapsis hits 80km, then circularize once you've left atmosphere.

That's all for today, folks. I'm going to see if I can apply my newly found piloting skills to something able to carry a useful amount of cargo...

BTW, these are designed to work with nuStock aero, but seeing as they're just ridiculously fast pipes with tiny wings, they might work under nuFAR.

Edited May 8, 2015 by Kagame
Woops, aero.
